repnme.cdata!:
Africa - West and Central Africa Air
            Transport Safety & Security Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The West and Central Africa Air
            Transport Safety & Security Project of Africa has
            moderately satisfactory outcome with moderately
            unsatisfactory performance by the Bank and a moderately
            satisfactory performance by the borrower. Lessons learned
            are as followed: Need to simplify project design in a
            complex and challenging implementation environment;
            participating countries should be grouped by capacity;
            Appropriate common grounds (geographic proximity, same
            regional entities) should also be considered; Project
            readiness is essential to ensure timely implementation;
            Realistic implementation time frame should be used for multi
            country complex regional project; Performance indicators
            should be limited to what is key to monitor outcomes and
            outputs; M&E framework should include regional
            dimension; Project design should be more regionally
            integrated; Complementarity and coordinated actions are key
            to promote broader air transport regional activities.

repnme.cdata!:
Africa - West and Central African Air
            Transport Safety and Security Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the West and Central
            African Air Transport Safety and Security Project for Africa
            are as follows: (a) improve Civil Aviation Authority's
            (CAA) compliance with International Civil Aviation
            Organizations (ICAO's) safety and security standards;
            and (b) enhance main international airports' compliance
            with ICAO's security standards. The restructuring will
            make it possible for Guinea to catch up with the progresses
            made by the three other participating countries by fully
            completing all on-going activities, and hence to continue
            reaching its objectives of strengthening CAAs' safety
            and security supervision, as well as to improve the
            project's outcomes and return its implementation
            progress to a satisfactory status. The recipient has in
            place an action plan which is acceptable to the Bank
            (revised procurement plans and activities completion
            schedule) to complete the project. The closing date is to be
            extended by one year, until June 30, 2014. This additional
            period of one year for the Guinea component is necessary to
            bring two current on-going activities to completion:
            delivery and installation of a new air navigation console
            for the control tower of Conakry, and the completion of
            drafts civil aviation code with its application texts. With
            the completion of those two activities, the project can
            close its financial accounts, but the Government and the
            Bank need to monitor the effective operationalization of the
            newly created CAA.

repnme.cdata!:
Africa - West and Central African Air
            Transport Safety and Security Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The West and Central African Air
            Transport Safety and Security Project for Burkina Faso,
            Cameroon, Guinea, and Mali aims to improve civil aviation
            authorities' compliance with safety and security
            standards of the International Civil Aviation Organization
            (ICAO), and enhance the main international airports'
            compliance with ICAO's security standards. The
            extension is consistent with the requirements of OP/BP 13.30
            as: (i) the Project's Development Objectives (PDO)
            continues to be achievable; (ii) the performance of
            implementing agencies and recipients is satisfactory; and
            (iii) an action plan has been prepared and agreed with each
            government to complete the project satisfactorily. The
            changes do not require any change in the project objective
            and description. Accordingly, the package is being processed
            as a level two restructuring, requiring the Vice
            President's approval since it involves a cumulative
            extension of the closing date of more than two years from
            the original closing date.
